III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Privacy safeguard
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12211
Section • (1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and his
Description or her family.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation
Agency shared confidential information regarding a respondent
parent with school personnel.
Investigation Interview with Birth Mother (BM) via telephone 11/6/24.
She reported she has completed all of her court ordered services
and is fully compliant. Birth Mother reported she has been sober
for a year on December 26, 2024. Birth Mother reported Foster
Care Supervisor from Forever Families is trying to “railroad her” by
going to Foster Child A’s (FCA) school and disclosing to school
personal information about her and her case. Birth Mother
reported Foster Care Supervisor of Forever Families reported that
she was a drug addict and a felon. Birth Mother did not provide a
name of the school personnel that the Foster Care Supervisor
disclosed her personal information too.
Birth Mother reported she was approved to be a mentor on a field
trip with FCA’s school and she was later informed she could not
go on the field trip because she was a felon and a drug abuser.
Birth Mother stated this information was given to the school
personnel by the Foster Care Supervisor for Forever Families and
FCA’s Biological Father. Birth Mother was not able to provide a
school personnel name that this information was given to about
her case history.
Birth Mother added additional information stating there was a
Family Team Meeting (FTM) and FCA’s Biological Father
disclosed false information against her and Forever Families took
away her unsupervised visits and made her visits supervised visits
at the agency with FCA. Birth Mother reported due to the false
allegations, she now has a pending investigation that will
determine when she receives unsupervised visits again. She
reported she has some concerns about FCA’s current placement
and feels it is not a safe environment for her child because FCA’s
Grandfather lives in the home with FCA and FCA’s Biological
2

Father. Birth Mother reported that only FCA’s Grandfather is a
felon. Birth Mother did not disclose how she knows that FCA’s
Grandfather is a known felon or if this information is factual.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) was interviewed on 11/8/24 via
telephone. She reported she was assigned to FCA’s case on
8/16/24. She reported FCA is doing very well in her current
placement with her Biological Father. She reported FCA has been
placed with Biological Father since 10/9/23. She reported FCA
was placed with her Maternal Grandmother from 7/7/21 – 10/9/23
and FCA’s Birth Mother had visitation with FCA at the Maternal
Grandmother’s home. These visits were being supervised by
Maternal Grandmother. FCW said a Family Team Meeting (FTM)
was held on 12/12/23 and the Maternal Grandmother reported
Birth Mother had been incarcerated and is now admitted to a
recovery center, which wasn’t able to be confirmed until 1/3/24.
FCW said Birth Mother was present when the recovery center’s
therapist returned FCW’s telephone call. FCW said Birth Mother
apologized to FCW for taking so long to reach out to the agency.
FCW said Birth Mother reported she was working on her recovery
to be a part of FCA’s life.
FCW reported FCA’s Birth Mother and Biological Father have a
toxic relationship and argue often in front of FCA. FCW said the
arguing does not get physical but, both parents spend a lot of time
making inappropriate complaints/allegations against each other.
FCW reported she does not know anything about her supervisor
reporting confidential information to FCA’s school personnel.
FCW also denied that she shared any of FCA’s personal
information with FCA’s school. FCW reported FCA is in a safe
placement and that she visits FCA monthly and that FCA’s
physical, emotional and developmental needs are being met.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) was interviewed via telephone
on 1/25/25. FCS reported on several occasions the school
personnel witnessed Birth Mother and FCA’s Biological Father
engaged in “yelling and screaming matches” among each other at
FCA’s school. She said she has witnessed FCA’s parents calling
each other inappropriate names and discussing their personal
business in front of the children and school personnel at FCA’s
school. She reported the school where FCA attends was unaware
that FCA was in foster care because FCA was placed with her
Biological Father.
FCS reported Birth Mother has supervised visits per a court order
with FCA. She reported she learned from FCA’s Biological Father
3

that Birth Mother was going to FCA’s school alone without
Maternal Grandmother who was authorized to supervise visits
between FCA and her Birth Mother and taking FCA out of school
early and before school ended. Birth Mother was taking FCA to a
dance class. FCS said Birth Mother was not authorized by their
agency to take FCA out of school and attend this activity alone.
She said Birth Mother only had supervised visits with FCA. FCS
reported when she learned of this information from FCA’s
Biological Father, she went to FCA’s school and spoke with the
school principal only about FCA being released from school on
Wednesdays with her Birth Mother. She said she shared with the
school principal that only certain people could pick FCA up from
school. She said she shared with the school principal that FCA is
placed with her Biological Father, and he is the legal guardian of
FCA. FCS said the principal informed her that she needed to
verify this information by way of a court order. FCS said she
provided the court order to the school principal only and this was
the only information that was shared with FCA’s school.
FCS denied sharing any other personal information about Birth
Mother’s case with the school principal. She said she has no
control over what Biological Father or Birth Mother might have
shared with FCA’s school. FCS reported the school made the
decision on their own regarding Birth Mother being a mentor on a
field trip with other children in the school. She reported she was
not aware Birth Mother was going to be a mentor on a field trip
and she did not mention this activity with school personnel, nor did
she have anything to do with the school decision of Birth Mother
going on a field trip with other children at FCA’s school.
Documents reviewed:
• FCA’s case file. FCA born 11/4/16, was placed with her
Biological Father on 10/9/23, where she remains to date. She is
up to date with her medical and dental examinations. She was
placed with her Maternal Grandmother from 7/7/21 – 10/9/23.
• Court Order dated 4/1/24 stating that FCA is to remain home
and/or released to legal father under the supervision of the
department.
• MDHHS report by DHHS Worker dated 11/26/24 concluded that
there was no finding of anyone living in the home with FCA with
any criminal charges.
4

Analysis Based on interviews and documentation reviewed the evidence
does not support the allegations that a staff member shared
confidential information about the Birth Mother’s case with school
personnel.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
